title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Very quick, 5 questions! You have 3 minutes to answer your questions and 20 seconds to prep. So it was very easy to get your words out. Questions were easy and not challenging at all.
Interview Questions: What was a challenging thing you had to face and how did you over come it

title: Operations Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: The whole process took about 3 months from the submission of my application to my final interview. The job posting was vague (did not specify what department the role was for) and the talent coordinator did not seem to have a clear understanding of the role and what the department was looking for. Speaking to the talent coordinator, he mentioned to me that "NMH is a political org so we will try to move as fast as we can but keep that in mind". My first interview was a standard 30 minute behavioral interview with the hiring manager. Next, I was moved to a 45 minute technical interview with a program manager. Then I did not hear from NMH for 2 weeks untiled I was asked to come onsite for a 2.5 hour in person interview. They gave me the full agenda 12 hours before my interview where I was scheduled to speak with the hiring manager again, a 3 person stakeholder interview, then an interview with their analytics manager, and then a panel interview with 5 clinicians managers (this role was non-clinical). All of the onsite interviews were behavioral based and similar questions were being asked in each round. I later got feedback that I did not get the role because I did not seem "overly excited" for the position and that the interviewers felt I should have not asked about career progression within this specific role and NMH as an overall organization. I found the process to be slow and there was scope crept regarding the role that I did not find out until I was at my onsite interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern Memorial? How do you tackle a task you've never done before? Where do you see yourself long term?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and professional, good questions and natural flow of conversation. Good listeners and top quality people. I highly recommend Northwestern Medicine. Come and check us out! Great group of people :)
Interview Questions: What are 3 of my top strengths?

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: This started with a day of zoom interviews, followed by a 2nd round of zoom interviews. No in person option during the pandemic. Interview lasted from around 8-3pm. Normal questions!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in our program?

title: Financial Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: It is a quick interview process with basic interview questions. My interview process was remote and it is a team of supervisors interviewing you and asking you a set of questions.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths? tell us about a time you had a difficulty with a coworker at work and how did you handle it?

title: Emergency Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to do a first round interview using an online screening service, which was very confusing. It asks you to respond to several prompts for about a minute each with only 30 seconds to prep and no opportunity to re-record your responses. I thought I must have bombed that interview because it was so awkward speaking to no one in particular, but they called me back for a second interview over zoom with the managers of my department, and it went fine.
Interview Questions: I don't remember specifically what they asked, but a lot of it had to do with my previous work experience and how it might relate to the job. They then explained to me some of the flow of the department

title: Registerd Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (McHenry, IL)
Interview Descriptions: HR was very knowledgeable and helpful. However, during the interview I realized they were not offering me the job I had applied to and tried recruiting me to different units. Tried to convince me to take a part time position. Despite this confusion, I still thought the interview went well but have yet to hear anything back from them about next steps.
Interview Questions: Asked a few questions about my goals as a nurse. Asked about evidence based practice.

title: Medical Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview was three rounds: phone, in-person, and video call with head doctor. The team asked standard questions about self, previous experience (with medicine and specifically with the department specialization), and how you would handle difficult patients. Able to shadow with department
Interview Questions: How would you handle a patient who is uncomfortable with an invasive procedure?

title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Huntley, IL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview went great for me, first they called me and did a quick phone interview and then we scheduled a virtual face to face interview with the hiring manager and then when the hiring manager felt that I would be a good candidate for the position he had me schedule a time to shadow the position itself.
Interview Questions: What is one weakness someone has told you that you had?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: it was very formal and they asked me a lot of questions about nursing scenarios, why I wanted to be a nurse, and what would you do in this scenario.
Interview Questions: Explain a time when you went above and beyond for a pt. How do you work in groups? Which patient should you tend to first?

title: Intern/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: First half - common interview with behavioral questions and then it was followed by: Second - followed by an excel testing portion Super friendly people, made it fun and engaging
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please

title: Department Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine

title: Member Of Technical Staff Interview

title: Student Nurse Extern Interview

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview

title: Data Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
Overall flow is smooth, applied via  referral for this position 
1. Hr call for 15 min to check on required skills and salary expectation 
2. Call with Hiring Manager for 30 min over all cv review and required skills, got rescheduled once following unavailability  
3. Call with Hiring Manager and Principal Technical Architect(1 hr)-technical  round/was a  limited to basic data warehouse questions around Dimension and fact
Interview Questions:
Technical Panel Round had below question
1. Describe your project and your role in that. 
2. How would you load a dimension table and which component you will use in ETL for it
3. How would you load a fact table
4. What are the 2 things you will check for while loading a fact table in oracle in terms of design and for requirement
5. use case : how would you design a process to load a fact table which when failed would load from that point ahead on rerun i:e If failed after loading 100 records out of 250, on rerun it will load 101 to 250th record
6. how is dedicated pool different than server less pool

Overall question from Principal Technical Architect were basic use case driven around dimension and fact  tables.
While Hiring Manager was lacking enthusiasm during the whole process ,was late for both round from 10-15 min and was in hurry to wrap up 

though was trying to piggy back on others question with little to no knowledge of what she was asking.
Interview felt very forceful from Hiring Manager end

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The process was very easy; I applied online, got a call the following day, scheduled the video interview for the next day, and received an email for a job offer two days later. I always send a follow up email after an interview and that may have helped with how quickly I received an offer.

Be sure to know that during the video interviews there may be 4-5 people from the department on the call, so be prepared for a lot of questions.

Come prepared with your own questions to ask them.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why are you interested in switching to this department? (I was working at another hospital in a different department at the time)
Q: What do you do when there is a mistake made at work?
Q: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult person at work.
Q: How would your co-workers describe you?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine

Interview Questions: N/A

title: Plastics Administration Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started out very smoothly. The hiring manager reached out to me via Indeed and within days I had a virtual interview with her. I even scheduled a phone interview with the HR representative the day after Thanksgiving. The next step was to interview in person. I arrived well dressed and ahead of schedule. I was very excited to meet everyone and had a great experience, or so I thought. Thinking back, I noticed that the surgeon who I was to potentially work under, was asking personal questions from the very second I sat down. He questioned if I had children and what type of education they were receiving. He automatically assumed they were enrolled in a public school and he went as far as to ask if the e-learning they experienced the past year had harmed them in any way. Which was odd but I thought he was just being curious. I thought it was going well when he abruptly ended the interview. Being that he is a highly regarded and very busy surgeon, I didn’t quite feel it was because he just simply made up his mind right then and there that I wasn’t a good fit. After, I continued to interview with the rest of the staff. I met  5 people in total and everyone seemed great! I felt pretty good leaving that morning. I followed up with an email when I had not heard back for almost 2 weeks, the hiring manager simply responded stating that there was another doctor they’d like me to meet. Making this the 4th interaction with one or more staff members. The interview was at 7:30am. This was my 2nd time driving up to the hospital and paying for parking. There was definitely effort on my end! When I arrived the doctor seemed frazzled. I thought maybe he had a busy schedule. He wasn’t really engaged as it seemed his mind was somewhere else. He’d start to speak on a subject and then forget where he was going with the conversation. At one point, someone walked in and he didn’t know who it was. I asked if it was his patient but he just seemed confused. The point is that he was not into the interview. I also ended up meeting his nurse that morning. My experience there was better but I left knowing that I wasn’t going to get a call back. Either way, a couple weeks later, I sent yet another follow up email thanking the hiring manager, congratulating them on finding the right candidate if it applied and asking for some feedback. At this point, I was 100% positive the position was not going to be awarded to me. Normally, this wouldn’t be a problem. It’s a part of the job hunting/interview process. I am not at all disappointed that I wasn’t chosen if I wasn’t a good fit but more so that I felt as though my race played a  role in their decision making. The entire office aside from 2 of their surgeons are Caucasian. I hate to think this way in this day and age and especially because the team seemed to mostly be millennials who are usually very aware and open minded. But I just cannot shake that feeling off! After she responded that a decision wasn’t made yet, I left it alone and thought that was her way of dodging my question of asking for a helpful critique. I received an email today after almost 2 months from the hiring manager. In the email she is telling me yes, yup! I’ll finally let you in on it, the position has definitely been filled BUT we’d like to offer you an opportunity to work the front desk. An entry level type of job. I have a degree and I have over a decade of customer service and management experience. That was in my opinion, rude. Yet, I still responded gracefully and with no ill words. I am a well qualified person who has years of experience but was offered an entry level role after so much effort and interest was placed. Hiring managers, please be aware that we are people too and that we also deserve to be acknowledged timely and please, please do NOT take it upon yourself to personally demote people! A quick critique or a, everything was great but we found someone more qualified would have sufficed!
Interview Questions: I was asked basic interview questions like, what would you do if you had a patient who was being aggressive. Give us an example of how you handled a similar situation in the past. I was also asked personal questions about my children’s education and what I personally thought about reconstructive and plastic surgery.

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Mostly behavioral. First round was video interview, then came in-person and interviewed with a total of 4 people. Nothing too hard, there was a quick excel case study to see how you can manipulate data and present information. Would also suggest to come prepared with questions about the role/company.
Interview Questions:
- Why are you interested in Northwestern Medicine?
- Walk me through your resume and experience.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was multiple steps from initial offer to occ health and clearance. It seemed overly complex for the position i was hired into. I would think this is why they hire out RN contracts versus actual staff new hires
Interview Questions: conflict resolution and team work abilities

title: Patient Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Completed a video interview with hirevue then interviewed with two managers. The first interview was sent to me within a week of completing the application. After one week, I was told to schedule a video interview with the two managers. It has now been a week, still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online received an email for a video interview, I interviewed with two managers. HR was very slow to respond, You must have 5 references two must be a manager and three from co workers or classmates you upload them online its a link to a survey you must have your reference email. The references honestly took the longest. After a month I get a call from HR rep and extended an offer. You will have to complete all onboarding and background check online.  I asked questions during the interview as well. For example what is changeling about this position etc...
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict with a patient? Since working remote how do you work with a team? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Case Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Automated process, quick response and flexible ability to schedule interview. Appreciated the ability to reply to my questions honestly and interviewer was upfront about job expectations and responsibilities. Process was not intimidating and assured me of a positive work environment
Interview Questions: What is your salary expectation

title: Emergency Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was an online interview where they used an online interview platform . The platform allowed you to practice interview questions and utilizing the program before beginning. Interview consisted of sending video responses for  different questions.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work at Northwestern Medicine specifically?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Naperville, IL) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: They had called me and asked me a few questions and then scheduled me to come in and continue the interview process in peson as well as give me a tour around where I would be working.
Interview Questions: why northwestern as a place to work?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews completed - both online (about a week apart). Met with managers a week ago and have not heard back yet. Overall, I’ve had a good experience. Just waiting to see what the next steps are.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: There was a digital interview first, which had some challenging questions, only 10 minutes long. Then a shadowing experience was set up. After the shadowing experience, an online video interview with the nurse managers.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict with a co worker. What was the conflict and how did you handle it?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Over the Phone and in person interview on unit with nurse manager, education coordinator, and two nurses from the unit as well. Each interviewer had own set of questions to ask candidate
Interview Questions: Biggest strengths and weaknesses in clinical setting?

title: Clinical Nurse (Psych ED) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Recruiter contacted me within 30 minutes of submitting my application. *No kidding* I scheduled an interview for the following week. MS Teams platform.  They immediately wanted me to apply for a different position than I applied for during the first,  interview (that was a red flag,  but I ignored it). I declined,  asked to continue with the scheduled interview. I was contacted by recruiting the next day to schedule a 2nd interview. Asked for 5 references (a bit much... but okay its "Nothwestern") I interviewed in person the following week. Met with one employee of the department,  the 
2nd person cancelled due to department emergency.  It happens.  The person,  I interviewed with seemed to have an issue with me returning school. She compared me to her daughter ( who worked there on days btw and had difficulty managing her work/school schedule) .  The manager already knew this info (about my attending grad school),  during the first interview.  So,  I was honest,  and to the point.  This is why I chose night shift.  I know what I can handle and  juggle accordingly.  Nursing is about time management after all.  The person I interviewed with worked part time day shift. 
Again,  the position I applied for was part-time nights. From that point on,  my commitment was a concern to department needs.  All went cold.  I received a rejection email  a week later.  Was it racism?  Did that lady I interviewed with suggest her daughter for the position?  Lol Should I have not been honest? I'll never know.  What I do know...I will NEVER again waste my time applying at the prestigious Northwestern  Memorial Hospital.  Extremely disorganized mess,  cloaked in name recognition.
Interview Questions:
My daughter works here and has trouble managing her schedule with school. How will you handle it? 

How are you with engaging different personalities?   Are you able to approach this in a respectful way? 

Do you get upset easily,  or easily worked up?

title: Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Recruiters are very bad at communicating after the interview. They will ghost you and not give you any follow up no matter how many times you email or call them.
Interview Questions: What software have you used in data analysis?

title: Registry Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: HR contacted to set up time. Virtual interview held for 30 minutes with 3 different members of the Physical Therapy rehab team.  Allowed questions at the end. Was difficult and not typical interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern what draws you in?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had one hiring manager from the floor and one nurse educator from the floor that conducted my interview. The flow of the interview was comfortable to the point we had nice side conversations. It lasted about 25 minutes.
Interview Questions: Please, tell me about yourself?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through a referral and received an email asking me to complete a 10-minute HireVue interview the next day. Completed it the same day and have not heard back in 1 week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern?

title: IR Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Two round virtual interview, seemed unorganized. Met with the manager and then with employees. Asked very basic questions - about my experience, then passed me along. Discussed the intense call schedule as well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience and how it applies to this role.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Geneva, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process started with a recorded video interview you complete at home. If video interview was acceptable HR would set up a manager interview and then peer interview the same day.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions such as what is your greatest strength, greatest weakness. Share you past work experience.

title: Clinical Quality Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
HR reached out and asked to schedule a call with Hiring manager - had a total of 3 calls 2 with the hiring manager and one with the team, later HR reached out and asked to fill in references, never heard back afterwards. Would have expected that they’d at least email me that I wasn’t selected after finishing the reference checking step. (Always been the same experience I have 4 experiences with Northwestern  when they ask to fill in references and they email references as well, and they never bother to get back with a at-least a generic rejected email.)
Respect the candidates time by at least getting back to them with your decision positive/negative.
Interview Questions: Asked to share examples of analysis I was currently working on for a healthcare organisation with  PHI on it and I refused stating the same, later I did create a detailed analysis with a presentation taking data from their public website

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a virtual interview, with little time to prepare answers, and about thirty seconds to record the response. There was not an opportunity to re-record responses. There was a total of three interview questions.
Interview Questions: What is one experience that made you think outside of the box?

title: Surgical Pathology Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I was first contacted by HR to schedule an in-person interview. The hiring lead and assistant were nice during the interview itself; the questions were mostly a mix of seeing right-fit and behavioral, with the latter focused on relevant soft skills such as time management. I also vaguely recall thinking that some of the questions were rather generic, but that's alright. They had also asked a question or two about my direct clinical/medical experience, which I did not have.
After the in-person interview, they gave you a lab tour with the chance for you to briefly shadow another technician and ask questions. I enjoyed that. It's good to see what your potential workplace will be like.

I never heard from them afterwards though, not even an automated rejection from HR.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself that is not on your resume.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was interesting experience. We conducted a virtual interview using Hireview program.  A series of questions were asked but you will have time to practice before you make your actual recording.
Interview Questions: What do you do in your free time. Explain how you diversity can help you in the program or as a physician.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Have a pre-interview with videos, phone interview with HR, then final interview with unit staff.  Staff was nice and informative. Very strict on references. The process took a couple of weeks to complete.
Interview Questions:
nursing process questions
why this specific specialty? Why this hospital? A time you dealt with patient who was anger.

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with 3 people, talked about what qualifies me for the position. Went over previous work experience, skills I have and skills I need to work on. The process was pretty straight forward
Interview Questions: What skills from previous jobs will help you succeed working here?

title: Data Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very streamlined, they know what they want and they do not mess around with multiple interviews or small talk. They'll do a base interview for abut an hour, and within a week you will know if you are hired or not.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you were not able to complete a task?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds of interviews, the first was a phone interview with hiring manager, second was a video interview with other managers in the department via Zoom, and final was with the director.
Interview Questions: What is an IP address?

title: Analytics Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Round 1: Phone Screening with the Recruiter
Round 2: Phone Screening with the Hiring Manager
Round 3: 1 hour live SQL coding
Round 4: Interview/Discussion with team members (around 1 hr)
Round 5: Interview/Discussion with a Program Manager (around 1 hr)
Round 6: Final Interview/Discussion with the Director and the Hiring Manager (around 1 hr)

I went through 6 rounds of interview over a period of 3 weeks and then "crickets". I emailed the Recruiter after a week or so, no response.  After waiting for another 10 days I get an automated email from the Recruiter thanking me for "applying for the position". I wasn't expecting a feedback but at minimum the Recruiter could have sent a personal rejection email considering the time I spent on 6 rounds of interview. I took time out of my current work schedule to prepare for it. The only reason I'm marking this as a negative experience is because of the Recruiter's POOR response skills. Otherwise the people who interviewed were easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: They are mostly trying to understand your experience and how you fit into the role and how well you do under pressure.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very kind staff and make you feel very comfortable. First a phone interview then with a hiring manager.  Questions varied in each interview. They let you know their unit environment and their expectations.
Interview Questions: How do you adapt to change?

title: Medical Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: 3 Interviews about 30 minutes each. 2 professors, 1 M4. Very easy to talk to, interested, and well-spoken interviewers. The virtual interview day made me feel very welcomed and wanted by the University.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to Northwestern?

title: Physical Therapist Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: After applying for the position, it took about 2 weeks for a recruiter to reach out and schedule a phone interview via Microsoft Teams. Phone interview was about 15-20 minutes long, pretty easy and laid back.  After about a week, I received a second invitation for a video interview via Microsoft Teams and had a video interview a week later. Video interview was much more intense, many questions involving situational questions and regarding communication and involved 4 different people. It took about an hour and 45 minutes.  They said within a week or 2 they would get back to say if there was an offer or not but this process had already taken well over a month in total and is very unprofessional if they are serious in finding another suitable candidate. I had found a job in the time of waiting but regardless if I had been given an  offer I would have declined due to the long process and lack of communication this company gave.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you did not receive  constructive criticism and what you did to resolve that?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Discussion based. Nothing too intense. Met with managers and director. Discussed background and interest in role. No case interview or technical skills testing. Nothing out of the ordinary during the process.
Interview Questions: Talk through project management and how you dealt with issues.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I think I got the low caliber employee. I applied to a position and got an email asking to set up a time for a call. I did that and she never made it. I called several times, emailed and did not get a response. I set up another time to speak. Again, she missed it. I again, emailed her asking if she was still interested and set up a third time to speak. She was late but made the third call. She seemed disinterested, distracted, couldn’t give a reasonable summary of the dob description. She did give me a timeline of the next steps but I never heard from here again. Not surprised. Waste of time and preparation.
Interview Questions: What salary are you looking for?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: hirevue interview in the beginning containing 5 questions. it was not that bad. I think the next process is to interview with hiring manager i am yet to be followed up
Interview Questions: questions like why do you want to work here, what makes a good team, how do you stay organized

title: PT Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Pleasant, direct and engaging conversation with me during the 15 min interview. I felt confident in the process afterwards to know what to expect when HR follows up with the potential candidates for the second round.
Interview Questions: What did you choose this type of setting right after graduation?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Deerfield, IL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a good experience even though it was remote. Pretty basic 3 step process. Phone interview, 2 video call interviews. The people that interviewed me were very knowledgeable and courteous.
Interview Questions: What drew you to Northwestern Medicine?

title: Student Nurse Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process first consisted of a video interview with 3 questions. Then after I completed the video interview,  I got an email about 3 weeks later that the company wanted to set up an in-person interview. This in-person interview was with a selected track and so I was only able to get a position from that unit directly.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern Medicine?

title: Administration/Management Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied Online, HR reached out for phone interview, and forwarded my resume and interview feedback to hiring director... Was invited in person for interview with physicians of the specialities, Operations coordinator and practice manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern medicine?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and not a lot of pressure from the peers! Did not ask the typical interview questions like strength and weakness or what would you did in this scenaro
Interview Questions: What would you change about your last job?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted a few days later. I did a phone screen that went over the role briefly and I answered questions about my interest. I was then scheduled for an HR and hiring manager interview. At this point this is when things started to get strange. I was asked to provide 5 references which seemed a bit excessive so early on in the process. Then, the day of my HR and hiring manager interview I was told hours before all of a sudden my HR interview was cancelled and needed to be rescheduled. I did the hiring manager interview which consisted of an overview of the position and some questions about my background as it related to the position I applied for. The hiring manager seemed keen on me as a candidate. They talked about the next steps of coming in to see the clinic while throwing out some potential dates/times and doing a peer interview. They confirmed my contact details and said they'd set up the next steps. I wait a week with no follow up. I reach out to the hiring manager then got a cold response saying I'd hear from HR. HR eventually rescheduled my interview after another week of waiting. This is when they did the "culture fit" questions which consisted of the typical "tell me about a time" questions. The waiting game resumed again for another week till I reached out then was told after a month of this drawn out process that they're no longer interested. It was a very misleading  and long process.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a coworker.

title: Analytics Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter called me and 1) phone interview 2)on-site interview. mostly behavioral interviews. The recruiter/interviewer were very nice people and respectful.  I would love to keep connected with them. Interviewed with them Feb.2020.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clinical Role Transition Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Two phone interviews due to pandemic. Was a little unsure whether they were going to be video or phone, be prepared for phone. Short 15 min interview with hiring manager and education coordinator. Questions ranged from prioritization, to why NMH, to questions about diversity and teamwork. Come prepared with your own questions.
Interview Questions: Why NMH, prioritization between 4 patients, what is teamwork, what is diversity, any questions for them.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Asked about database experience, and Healthcare experience.  Met with two separate department heads at the same time for similar positions in different areas.  Met virtually due to ongoing restrictions on being in person.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in healthcare?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were still being held over zoom at the time so that was a downfall but also a bonus. Overall the interview was a pleasant experience. Not much small talk, straight to the point. Heard back from them within the same day.
Interview Questions: What is 5x25? (critical thinking question to ensure you don't jump to conclusions)

title: IHR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Was on the computer due to COVID.  We used Teams and it worked very well without any glitches. I was prepared to have my camera on but we ended up just using the microphone feature. Interview included myself and two others.
Interview Questions: What was an obstacle you had to overcome and what did it teach you?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: They sent a request for a video interview due to covid. I will be taking the interview today . I will update you guys on how this goes. wish me luck!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself /

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Video, Phone, & In-person
HR will contact you if they view your video interview. The video interview is very quick and easy and you are timed and must be prepared to answer questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NMH?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online at Northwestern Medicine's website. After a week I received an email back from them stating the department manager would like to interview me with two other supervisors.
Interview Questions:
Introduce yourself

Name a time you had to explain something in depth to a patient that had a hard time understanding 

Why do you want to work for Northwestern Medicine

Will you be able to commute to work okay every day

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy. Applied, received an email for the virtual interview the next week.  Once I did the virtual interview they emailed me exactly 1 week later to do an online interview(covid) with 3 managers. That interview was very relaxed, easy scenario questions, and very informative. *You’re made aware of your salary during the first request for an interview(I really love that process, no guessing)*
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you and coworker didn’t agree and what was the outcome.
Describe a time when you had to take the lead.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: After filling out an application on NWM's website and submitting a resume, the interview was conducted over Microsoft teams with one of the floor's managers and one of the nurse educators.  The interview took about 30 minutes total.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working in the ICU at Northwestern?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Online interview process was easy to do. Northwestern Medicine was very organized which made the process run smooth. I applied for the job and got an interview within the same week. Very quick and punctual
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern

title: PCT/CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: Due to COVID19 was completely online and over the phone. First started with an online screening where you submit video-recorded answers to specific questions. Then once screening is accepted followed up with an over the phone interview where the manager asked similar questions to the video recorded screening questions.
Interview Questions: Q: Name a time you dealt with a difficult patient, how you handled it, and what was the outcome.

title: ER RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was great. First half with higher ups and then second half with a couple RN's from unit to see if i fit. Everyone was so kind but also direct.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this hospital?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very streamlined and organized! I was impressed with the professionalism of the team, and even though it was by Zoom it was very thorough and punctual. It was definitely one of my better interview experiences.
Interview Questions: Focused on my goals for the position and making sure it was a good fit

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then had emailed with recruiter and had a teams interview with 2 managers of the unit. I was then asked to enter my references, and when I had submitted them, I discovered by smart recruiters page that I was no longer being considered. Overall seemed disorganized and had a lack of communication. Also feel like you need significant RN experience to be considered for a position
Interview Questions: Why NW, why this unit, tell us about a time you worked with a group and the outcome, tell us about a disagreement you had with a coworker and how you handled it

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is ridiculously long. I have been trying to get into Northwestern for over three years and have had countless interviews. Sometimes they will call you back for a second interview two months later. It comes down to them having time to hire or completely ghosting their applicants. I will be looking elsewhere in the future of healthcare once i achieve my BSN. Nobody deserves this type of treatment just to apply for a job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Regsistered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started off with a live timed recording of myself. Next  HR called and reached out to me. The last step of the process was that I had another run person interview with the floor manager.
Interview Questions: Name a time I saw a coworker treating staff poorly, and what did I do to correct it.

title: Sterile Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied on a Monday, on Wednesday I was contacted to do a phone interview on Friday. On Friday we had the phone interview, Monday I received an email asking for references. After that was complete it took two days to get an offer.
Interview Questions: What did you do in the past when you had conflict ?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. Then you’ll be asked to do an online self interview where you record your responses. If chosen, you’ll get an in person interview and shadow experience. The time frame between these things is usually a couple of days.
Interview Questions: Why northwestern? Why are you interested? How do you handle stress?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview, then in person interview with the unit manager, then notified a week later about the position and if you were able to proceed. Hiring process took about a month.
