title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: First it is a Fairly straightforward online questionnaire, then followed by a easy phone interview. It is a long process where you don’t usually know where you are at which can be hard.
Interview Questions: What are five words you would use to describe you

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went fairly quickly - I was able to do an interview via HireVue app on my phone, I scheduled a shadowing opportunity for 8 hours on the unit and then professional interview the following week. All went smoothly - they accommodated my schedule well and were very kind.
Interview Questions: Why northwestern?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very smooth, set up the interview with HR, meet with the department supervisor and go through the interview questions. They will be in touch with you within a week.
Interview Questions: Phlebotomy procedures

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
2 phone interviews and one longer in-person interview with ~6 different people (always 1 on 1) 
The phone interviews were with administrative people, the in person interviews were physicians and other APPs and 2 nurses
Interview Questions: Why northwestern

title: Social Work Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: They only accept second year social work students. I submitted resume and cover letter, phone interview then one  in-person interview, then was offered the position and only had three days to accept
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you used problem solving

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I had a Zoom interview with two interviewers, but I wasn’t told to expect two interviewers at the same meeting. It wasn’t a personable conversation and felt a little drilled on clinical application questions. Generally, the whole interview felt coldly professional- very telling of the culture, in my opinion. 

I would have been moving out of state for the job and expressed the desire to have some buffer time (3 months) to make the transition and they seemed displeased with this. If you are applying as an out of state candidate, it doesn’t seem like they are willing to wait and will pressure you. 

I wasn’t offered the position. After the interview, I wouldn’t have accepted in any case.
Interview Questions: I was asked several clinical scenario questions.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Group of 3 people from different departments interviewed for a range of possible roles within the oncology research department. The interview process was around half an hour and they provided some feedback after the interview through my recruiter. The interview took place only a couple of weeks before COVID-19 so the positions were not longer active.
Interview Questions: My past experience in clinical research, my project management background, why I wanted to go back into clinical work, what I'm currently focusing on at my current job, where I see myself in 5 years.

title: Diagnostic Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy interview and hiring process. It took about a month to get into my position after job offer, physical, and first day orientation. Lengthy process was well worth it though because I have a great job.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively easy. It was a phone interview. The phone interview was just the first round of interviews. The whole interview was only 30 minutes long. The conversation was brief and went by very quickly.
Interview Questions: What excited you the most about the position?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Used HireVue initially, then an in-person interview, then waited for the call. It moved quickly and all of the people involved were great. I was new to the downtown environment, as well as using HireVue, but I figured it out quickly and felt very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a situation when you disagreed with another nurse. How did you handle it?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Hirevue video interview is the first step with a on campus interview if you progress to the next round. They ask about different situations and how you would handle them when working with a team, etc. Pretty basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses/things you need to work on?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: pretty standard interview process, they ask you about yourself, why you think you fit the job, specific questions about your work background related to the healthcare field. the interviewer was friendly and really passionate about her job
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you faced a difficult decision

title: Social Worker - LSW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with SEVEN people in one room. It was incredibly overwhelming and very hard to focus on answering questions when 14 eyes are staring at you. Even after that, I never received an email or call about the position or that they were moving on without me. It was just radio silence.
Interview Questions: How would you learn what you don't already know about this position?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received and email to completed a video interview that same day. After completing the video screening, I received a call from HR to set up and shadow day and then an interview with the unit managers.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why Northwestern?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position on the career site. I was offered a video interview opportunity within one day of applying via email. The video interview was very straightforward and easy to navigate.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Northwestern Memorial Hospital?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Lake Forest, IL) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call back the next week to set up a job interview. The managers were really nice and laid back. They were very informational and helpful with any questions I had. They went into depth about the unit and the orientation. Overall, it was a really good experience but I am still waiting to hear back if I got the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you deal with difficult patients.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Its been so long I got hired that I do not remember what kind of process it was. I think I meet with an administrator and a clinical nurse supervisor.
Interview Questions: what is my experience

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
Received a personalized email to complete a video-based interview. Completed in a timely fashion and never heard back from NW, even after politely following up several times. It is an embarrassment that NW’s talent acquisition team could not take 30 seconds to write an email or leave a voicemail, especially given the hours of preparation and practice for these types of interviews.

Thankfully, they added me to a spam email list so I get emails once a week titled “help your friends get great jobs” that I’m not allowed to unsubscribe from. I won’t be interviewing with NW again after that experience.
Interview Questions: “Tell me about a time...” type questions.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the NM career website. Then shortly after recieved an email to complete the Video interview process through HireVu. I hope that my chances aren't slim becasue I've never done a video interview before.
Interview Questions: Why do you see yourself working at Northwestern?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a hiring event . I saw the post and applied . Did a HireVue interview . Took a about 3-4 weeks. Called me 2 days before event and sent my invite. Did my interview and was hired on the spot!
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Northwestern Medicine's HR department reached out within 2 weeks of submitting my application, set up an initial phone screening the following week, first round interview the next week and offer a month later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you were under a lot of pressure from different stakeholders with demanding deadlines

title: Patient Access Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was sent an email to take an interview on hirevue(Ask 5 questions)(3. Min per question).Then weeks later call to do an face to face interview. I went got hire that day
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at northwestern?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online then was asked to submit a video recorded interview. After I submitted my video, was invited to an in person interview. Whole process from initial application to offer took about 1 month. Had opportunity to shadow on unit after in-person interview which I appreciated
Interview Questions:
Describe a time you went above and beyond for a patient
Tell me about a time you made a mistake at work

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from HR to set up a meeting with the management team. I went to the hospital, was interviewed briefly, then shadowed a nurse on the floor for approx. 1 hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me 3 words your current boss would use to describe you?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: shadow for 4 hours with a nurse then interview with manager of the floor. Interview was about 30 minutes long asked about what I liked about northwestern as well as gave me specific patient details and I had to describe what I would do in that situation
Interview Questions: why northwestern and why the specific unit

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Grayslake, IL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an application online and received a call back for an interview 2 weeks later. My interview was at the outpatient center in a private office with the director of rehabilitation. Total interview time was about one hour.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite type of patient to work with?

title: Clinical Role Transisiton Program- ONCOLOLY and NEURO/ORTHO Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: About 70 students form varies contracted Universities were chosen for interviews in various areas at Northwestern. 10 minute interviews were scheduled for each student in two areas that each showed interest in. Everyone was in the same room at the same time interviewing for different units. At the end of the first 10 minute interview students would move to the next interview, until their two interviews were completed.  Each interview had employees from the floor as well as floor managers in attendance. It took about 4 weeks to hear back about placement.
Interview Questions:
Why Northwestern? 
Why nursing? 
Why are you interested in Oncology? 
How did you handle a disgruntled patient?
Explain a time you were a leader and/or handled conflict?
Time I went above and beyond for a patient? 
Time I made a mistake on the floor?
Favorite Clinical experience?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: After 2+ weeks, I got an email asking for a video interview. A week later, I got a phone call asking for an in person interview. After the interview, I was asked to shadow a PCT for an hour.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (New York, NY) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was asked to do the online interview, I was called the next day to come in for the in person interview. The 2 managers started the interview about 10 minutes late, asked about 4 questions with many moments of silence between questions. I already knew 2 minutes into my interview started I was not a candidate they were looking for based on although I am a RN with a BSN. Very uncomfortable experience. Learn how to treat people who take their time to interview with you.
Interview Questions: Why NW?

title: Psychometrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview. Met with the practice manager and then with the Neuropsychologists. Asked me about prior experience, test competency, why I would be a goof fit, strengths and weaknesses, etc.
Interview Questions: Which neuropsych tests I was competent on

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: They made you fell comfortable.  They asked about past experience and how I can contribute to the organization.  They asked what I liked about past job and also dislikes of past employment
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: The first step was an online interview. A question appeared on the screen and you recorded a response.  You had as much time as you needed to prepare an answer to the question, but only one shot to record.  After that, I was asked back for an in-person interview.  The in-person interview was with two people (the unit manager and educator). I was also given the unit tour. Was offered the position two days after the interview.
Interview Questions: What would your clinical instructor say is your greatest strength?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very great interview process - accommodating and understanding.  They really are compassionate and are flexible on hiring new grad RNs and working around your schedule.  I would say it was one of the smoothest interview processes I have ever had.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing?

title: Coding Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: First a coding test, then after you passed the coding test, you got to meet with the Coding managers and then asked you a series of questions. They got back  to you in a timely manner.
Interview Questions: What kind of coding do you not like?

title: Cerified Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (McHenry, IL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very long process, I had never had an interview process take quite as long. Know the basics of your position and expect to be quizzed on the basics. Very friendly staff and very knowledgeable on their work and how it would mesh with the work you would be doing in the event of a job offer.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you experienced conflict with a coworker, if you had a conflict with a coworker at our institution how would you handle it.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Met with 4 people in the department, asked various questions about previous work experiences and gave hypothetical situations to react to. After the interview, they give a tour of the lab and explain the tasks and processes of the job.
Interview Questions: How did you respond to and overcome a difficult situation you have faced in previous employment?

title: Pre-Med Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application, and they got back to me within two days for an interview. The interview was online and had to be completed before a deadline. I just recorded myself answering the questions that were presented. There was one minute to read the questions and think about the answer and four minutes to respond.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Northwestern Medicine?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to the blitz interview. 
There was an online interview first. Then there was an in person interview directly onto the unit.
short and straight to the point. 
There was shadowing after the interview. 
Most of the questions were "tell me about a time..." questions.
Interview Questions: why northwestern, why nursing?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Quick, met with HR and hiring manager all in one day. However, it took awhile to finish the paperwork and recieve a start date. I think the turn around time was almost a month, but it was worth the wait.
Interview Questions: Basic personaility questions and experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email a month later for a digital interview. Two days later received a call for an in person interview and waiting to hear back after shadowing unit.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online Monday, did an over the phone interview Tuesday, and had an in person interview Friday with the two managers and shadowed a nurse for an hour.
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions:
Good experience, until no one ever followed up with me after my in-person interview. Why not tell candidates they didn’t get the position, or will not be moving forward in the process? I reached out to HR, and still silence. 

Many candidates like myself take time off work to interview. A follow-up, even if the position is not being offered, is a common courtesy. Ghosting is unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Standard interview

title: Registered Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process didn’t take long and the managers don’t grill you like some others. They go off your resume and just explain how you are and what you do beat
Interview Questions: Tell me something I can take away from this interview that will make you stand out from the rest?

title: Patient Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (McHenry, IL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Met with the hiring manager for first interview for a one on one. Peer interview was with 4 other individuals, department heads  for a 15 minute interview. This process had the top candidates all
Interview
Interview Questions: What interested me in the position

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very short and easy. They were friendly and kind. They are open to many different people and are great. I had a great time meeting new people there. one two three four five six seven eight nine ten eleven twelve thirteen.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview was via HireVu online video process where you had to answer about 10 questions and record yourself doing it to submit your answers. Process was easy but different than a typical phone screen. Would recommend watching a practice video online and limit any distractions when recording the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NW

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Application was straightforward. I heard back from HR very quickly and scheduled an interview within the next week or so. Went in for a group interview (3 on 1) that seemed to went well. Never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Experience based questions with a certain population

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Video interviews - asked same questions as job application. Waste of time - don’t bother applying here. Incredibly impersonal.  A phone interview or a Skype interview is a more useful tool than this.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you helped a patient.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview, In person interview with  manager, shadow portion with nurses on the unit, verification process. If hired 6 months preceptorship with several if the nurses.  Attend several classe and in-services
Interview Questions: Patient acuity qs

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Started with introductions of interviewers and interviewee. Brief intro about NMH and their labs. Moved to questions based on lab experience and science background. Interviewee was asked why they wish to join NMH and what they hope to gain/bring to NMH. Further questions related to working in a lab and troubleshooting scenarios.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you encountered a problem in the lab, either technical or not, and the process you took to resolve it.

title: Certified Occupational Therapy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. Two interviewers sat and told me about the company as well as policies and job expectations. We then had a typical back and forth conversation about my experience and qualifications. I felt very comfortable throughout the entire interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little about yourself.

title: Patient Care Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
It was really a very unprofessional experience from start to finish.
I do believe these interviewers are not trained .  It is a very negative impression they give to professional people looking for a job.  I have a very different opinion of Northwestern in Warrenville Il.  after this interview.
I differently walk away saying , I WOULD NEVER WORK HERE.
Interview Questions: what is your weakness?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I'm from Michigan and I applied to the nurse externship for the summer term last year (2017). I cannot remember details, but I was extended an interview on the neurology unit in March. The manager was kind. But in retrospect, I wasn't super prepared for the interview and/or to answer the behavioral style questions. I was told I would receive a decision via email or phone call within the next two weeks to notify me either way. However, I received an offer from Duke 2-3 days after my NW Medicine interview, and I accepted that position. I did not receive notification about the initial NW position, but I was emailed several weeks later by another NW recruiter inquiring if I would be interested in interviewing for a nurse extern position on a different unit. Seemed to be a little bit a disconnect.
Interview Questions:
When did you experience a conflict with another person at work? How did you solve it?
What is your greatest strength/weakness?
Recall a time where you made a mistake at work. How did you handle that situation?

title: Patient Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I was sent an invitation to participate in a video Interview. I am still waiting to hear back from the hiring committee regarding the next steps. In a previous interview for a different role, I was called back for an in person interview following the video interview after two weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and one weakness.

title: Registered Nurse/Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Some phone questions and interview questions. A 1 hour shadow to see how I worked. I had to wear scrubs and follow 2 different nurses. It was a good interview and the shadow went well.
Interview Questions: Why NM? Strengths and Weaknesses.

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The managers listened carefully after asking appropriate questions. The managers realize there needs to be a work-life balance and encourage that balance. They were very nice people and competent in their roles.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about your experience.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Easy hiring process. Not enough professionalism. Takes forever to get back on the process. Not impressed with the hiring process overall. Not recommended for serious candidates
Easy hiring process. Not enough professionalism. Takes forever to get back on the process. Not impressed with the hiring process overall. Not recommended for serious candidates
Interview Questions: Experience and skills, about yourself and about the company

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online to attend a  nurse hiring event in November. After submitting my resume, I was asked to do a phone screening interview. They got back to me a week later and said that I was accepted. At event, I met managers from many different floors. Got a call a few days later saying they wanted me to shadow the floor and interview.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself?

title: New Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was not bad. They ask a lot of behavioral questions. They asked me to shadow the unit for two hours. The manager seem pleasant. It was a panel interview include: nurse manager, charge nurse and peer review
Interview Questions: Tell me a time you have a difficult patient.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was done by three women for the L&D unit. Very intimidating to be in a small room with three higher-up women asking you difficult questions... It was my first interview outside of nursing school but still difficult
Interview Questions: Name a time someone has given you constructive criticism and how you’ve taken it

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: Process took a total of 4 weeks. First completed an online interview with HireVue then received a call from HR a few days later. I then scheduled a day to shadow the unit for a full 8 hours followed by an in person interview one week later.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwestern?

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not hired yet, I did a virtual inveiw was a little stressful, but just be honest in your answers and look at the screen while talking, dress professional and use proper English, they contact you via email throughout the process leading up to the intial interview
Interview Questions: What can you bring to this position?

title: Value Analysis Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I began the process of interviewing for this position in late-October. My direct contact was a member from the team who I met with for my first interview. Following this interview I met the Value Analysis and Strategic Sourcing team in a final interview. This final meeting consisted of 30-minute interviews where I met 9 people within 3 hours. The team did not follow-up within a reasonable 1-week timeline. I followed up 2 times, both with the Director and HR contact to inquire about the position. After my final interview and follow-up I waited 3-weeks.
Interview Questions: Give me an example for when you worked with imperfect data and how you work in these situations?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Process was fairly easy. Phone call, followed by digital interview a few days later. After that, an interview in person as well as job shadow. One week after interview, called with offer.
Interview Questions: Digital: Tell me about yourself. Why NM? Why this unit? Tell about a time you encountered a difficult patient and how you handled it. In Person: Went down resume. Tell me about the nursing program you graduated from. Describe immersion and the patient population you cared for.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Initially submitted my application and was then contacted to complete a video interview 3-4 days later. After submitting my video interview, I was contacted by HR to come in for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you advocated for a patient

title: Nursing Hiring Event Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had to use Hirevue, an interview app. This was a negative experience for me, because I did it on my phone completely and the app didn't submit my videos correctly, so I had to redo the whole interview again a day later. I did like the idea of the app though, video question prompts.
Interview Questions: status of your license

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (McHenry, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews went well. One with Director and HR then with Peers. I was actually called and had a phone screening first with HR. I was then invited back for an interview with the Security Director and HR. After about a week I was scheduled to speak with three security officers to see if I would be a good fit. Within another week I was given an offer and excepted.
Interview Questions: Explain a situation I had to overcome with a co-worker

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for a hiring event that I found on the Hospital website. After completing the application, I received an email 1 day later asking to do a digital interview. The interview had a total of 8 questions. You had 30 sec to read the question and 3 minutes to answer it. You are also given 3 practice questions if you choose to practice before the actual interview. Once you do the actual interview you can not go back and change your answers.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to deal with an unhappy patient, family member, or coworker and how you handled it.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I did the video interview it was 8 basic questions, why do i want to work there? how i handle conflict? when can i start? describe a time i went above and beyond for a patient? etc then I got a phone call a few days later to set up an in person interview, in person interview was with the floor manager and 2 other nurses (they had important postitions like education and clinical coordinator) in the same room, the questions were similar to those of the video questions, they asked about things on my resume (volunteer, previous work experience) etc, then they explained things about their floor and asked if i had any questions. the interview took about 35 minutes then I shadowed a nurse for 1 hour. The experience was very great overall but that was a few days ago and I have not been given a response (yes you got the job or no you did not get the job) I am hoping for the best
Interview Questions: why do i want to work there?

title: Social Woker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Received email from manager of Social Work Dept to schedule an interview. The following week I had the interview with the manager, clinical lead, and the social work team. A lot of situational and background questions, not too difficult.
Interview Questions: How do you handle ethical dilemmas

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for position.  Received an email within a week  to participate in a video  interview (recorded not real time).  3-4 days later, received phone call from HR to schedule an in-person interview with unit clinical manager and other staff members plus possibly shadow the unit (if offered at time of interview).   Had the in-person interview then got the opportunity to shadow the unit for 1-2 hours.    Received an official offer via phone call from HR 1-2 days later.   Accepted.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years? 
How would you contribute to our team? 
One clinical situational question.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and after few days got an email to take the interview online through the app Hirevue. I thought the application process itself was easy to navigate and managable. I haven't heard back yet but I hope to get in as  I am extremely excited to start the job.
Interview Questions: One conflict and how did you handle it?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the hiring event they are having Aug 15.  The  following day I received the email to take the video interview.  You have to answer questions and record yourself.  FYI you can not re-record yourself.  This felt very impersonal and uncomfortable.  It’s been a week and I have not heard from them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwestern.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy. Three people interviewed me at one time and it was question after question no time to think of your response but it was the typical interview questions. The three managers were so nice. Over all, it seems overwhelming but it’s not.
Interview Questions: Previous time you handled a Irate situation.

title: Customer Service Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I was an internal candidate.  I still had to go through the first step of a HireVue video "interview", which is incredibly off-putting, demeaning, impersonal, I could go on for ages.  However, I was quickly contacted for an in-person interview.  The interview went well, and within a week I received a verbal job offer.  At this point it became clear to me that the recruiter had not been forthcoming about some important details, so I asked for some additional information.  Never heard back from the recruiter.  Guess I asked too many questions.

Did not realize that applicants (including internal applicants) are treated so poorly.  My experience was vastly different when I was first hired.  This particular experience has made me seriously reconsider my future with this organization.  I was given the runaround by HR/recruiters.  It's a shame because the actual staff members I met with seemed wonderful.  It's just the bureaucratic process that ruins everything.  

I would recommend NM for people who want to get a job and then stay in that same job for years and years.  I would not recommend NM for anyone who wants to actually develop skills, grow with the company, etc.
Interview Questions: Standard stuff--why are you a good fit for this position, why are you interested in this position, how do you handle difficult situations/co-workers, etc.

title: Infusion Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Once submitted application, interview was quick. Intreview with 3 people and they are all asking questions. They were looking for experience with chemotherapy.  It is a busy clinic. Want you to juggle the busy patients.
Interview Questions: One word to describe yourself

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online on their website just via simple job search. I got an email informing me on details for a video interview, which I thought was the most difficult part. Then received a phone call confirming the in-person interview date and time.
Interview Questions: Directer was so sweet, she mainly asked about past experiences from my resume.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Oak Park, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I Received an email by the hiring manager to set up a face to face interview.Interviewed with the practice manager and a peer for about 30 mins.  After that interview I received an email to send 5 references. Then about a week later was asked for a 2nd interview to meet their practice owner of the facility. After meeting him I did not get a good impression.  He kept saying he didn't need a bilingual person and that he saw at his office was more polish speaking patients.  I felt discriminated. Hope it doesn't happen to any one else. After that couple days later I got an email that there going to go with other candidates. They wasted my time thank you north west medicine clear skin dermatology.
Interview Questions: Experience with dermatology?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted via email and instructed to complete a virtual interview with my laptop or smartphone. It consisted of 5 questions with 3 minutes to answer each. The email said the hiring staff would review my answers and contact me if I were to proceed further in the process.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult patient you dealt with.

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Video Interview - 30 sec to prepare, 3 min to answer for the video answer in the interview, mainly focused on previous experience and how that applies; there were a few written questions interspersed as well about availability
Interview Questions: availability and previous experience

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied on a Sunday. Got the email inviting me for the video interview. I downloaded that app to my phone and did it right away. An hour later I received a call inviting me for a in person interview the next day. The hiring manager was sticky sweet and answered all of my questions that I had. The day after the interview I received an email asking for my 5 references. It took a week and a half after the reference email was submitted to get a call to come in for shadowing to see if I liked the unit. I went in on a Wednesday and got a offer email on Friday. I was able to negotiate my salary because on my application they ask what your minimum requirement is. They came in offering lower than my requirement but I countered the salary and got what I asked.
Interview Questions: Name a time that you didn't perform to your fullest potential and what did you learn from it

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: VIdeo process was easy. 8 questions on various topics. There are some practice questions you can do beforehand to get familiar with the process. Some questions were where do you see yourself in 5 years? What unit would you like to work on?
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at NM?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Hirevue, then two phone calls with managers and team. They asked mainly about my time at school and what I am looking for at Northwester Medicine. Just be yourself and be honest. They have a great team and are looking to help you succeed.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this postion

title: Patient Transporter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview process flowed smoothly.  I received a call from HR and the interview was set a week later. During that time the supervisor of my soon to be new department was very good about staying in touch via email and making sure any questions I had were answered. After I was hired, very good communication was maintained from HR and even the orientation was effective and efficient. It was a great experience.
Interview Questions: How would you interact with a patient that has a hard time hearing or comprehending?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for a position in March and did not hear back until May, this may be because I am a new grad...but the application and interview process is very long!
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you made a mistake and what you did to fix it

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: First you have to submit a video resume, then phone screen with HR, in-person interview and then 3 hour shadowing. It is a relatively long process but the interview was very pleasant, professional and comfortable. I got the offer 4 days after the in person interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here, What's your long term plan/goals, what can you contribute to the team

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview with management from start to finish was about 30-40 minutes. All 3 managers were kind and easy to hold conversation with. They all asked for a copy of my resume, thank goodness I brought plenty! I was glad I asked them several questions at the end, they responded well to that.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Everything took about 2 weeks from when I applied. First I did the video interview, which had about 9 questions such as Tell us about yourself, Why do you want to work for NMH.. etc. I was contacted by HR for an unperson interview maybe a week after, went to the interview and interviewed with the unit manager, charge nurse, and nurse educator. Overall, I gave it a negative review because the interview was very rushed. Maybe 15 minutes long. The HR was pretty unorganized and I had to keep calling them to make sure the interview was still happening.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work on this unit? Describe a situation when you had to give constructive criticism/when you had to receive constructive criticism? Are you a team player? What is your weakness?

title: PCT/PSC Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (McHenry, IL) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were more collaboration than safety questions. I was expecting the opposite. They want to know when you would ask for help, if you are willing to work in a group.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to go up the chain of command. How did you handle the situation?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job and within 3 days I received a request to do the video interview. A couple days later I was asked to come in for the in person interview. I sat with both the managers on the unit for about 20 minutes, then I went and shadowed a nurse on the unit for 45 minutes. It was a very positive experience, everyone was very nice and welcoming.
Interview Questions: Tell us something fun about yourself

title: Financial Assessor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Schaumburg, IL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email a week later for an in person interview. Interview consisted of me meeting with the hiring manager and then a peer interview. I received a call 1 week later with a job offer. After the offer, required to do a thorough background check and drug test/physical.
Interview Questions: Name a mistake you’ve made

title: Outreach Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  One week later, received invitation to complete virtual interview through Hirevue App.  Average behavioral interview questions...some unrelated to job description.  Received email from recruiter stating other candidates were being considered.
Interview Questions: How do you handle adversity?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied for an RN position and got the email to complete an online/digital interview that took about an hour.  A total of 8 questions that were pretty basic. I waited 2 weeks to hear back from HR and did not hear anything. I had to call them to find out if I landed the in person interview or not.
Interview Questions:
I did not expect the question pertaining to my qualifications.
Other than that, they were pretty basic questions such as where do you see yourself in 5 years, why NW, and and a patient priority scenario

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Very Straightforward. The first interview was through HireVue and honestly, you should really nail this. Most people are going to have similar skills but they want to see confidence, cultural fit, and the ability to articulate yourself. I was invited for a second interview shortly after and the second interview was very conversational and laid back. I don't know if it was my experience or background but I was never really grilled on hardcore IT concepts. You're interviewing with the department manager for certain team and its really to see how you can be an asset/fit to their team. Be familiar with the company values, have some experiences you can elaborate on, humor goes a LONGGG way, don't be arrogant and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Why NM? If a (Silicone Valley Company) offers you a job and so does NM, who will you choose?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a hiring event online through their careers portal. A recruiter had touched base about confirming availability to attend the event. At the hiring event itself, interviewed in a ballroom with several tables with different managers representing different floors and units. Quick short interviews with a sort of "speed dating" vibe and then was asked to shadow on 2 floors. 2 weeks after the interview, a recruiter touched based and asked me to come in for another interview/shadow with a different floor. Got word that I was hired the next day and began the process.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in a year, 5 years?

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Completed online interview video/ following week HR requested interview/ did interview and I was asked general questions ( environment wasn't stressful)/ HR got back to me right after interview/ 5 References were required to complete email surveys online/ Job Offer
Interview Questions: How would you handle a upset patient or a stressed out Doctor?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a video interview with them first very simple process read the question and record your answer they even give you a practice run on each question. After that there's a short skill check quiz. Then a few weeks later I got called in for an in person interview.
Interview Questions: What made you want to work for northwestern?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Carol Stream, IL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Asked scenario based questions to gauge your overall temperament and if you work well under pressure. The rest of the questions just gauged your communication abilities, experience and fit with the company culture.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with patients that are angry or unhappy?

title: Patient Engagement Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized with HR - had several people contacting me with overlapping requests. Department communication however was great. Interviewers were respectful and kind - very welcoming. They had answers to all my questions and helped me understand the role I would be undertaking - they didn't just grill me on my qualifications.
Interview Questions: The role doesn't involve as much patient-interaction as come candidates would hope - are you okay with that?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the position online. I was contacted for a video interview about a week later via email. Then I was asked to come in for an in person interview. Met with the manager and a floor nurse for about 30 minutes, then was asked to shadow on the floor for about 30 minutes (they asked me to bring a pair of scrubs to change into
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwestern Medicine?

title: RN Interview

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview (where you video record responses to preset questions) then recruiter called me to set up interview with unit manager in person. After that interview I got a callback about a week later with the job offer.

title: Call Center Representative Interview

Interview Questions:
How does your background fit this role?
What are your strengths? 
Are you able to work in a high-volume stressful environment?
Describe a time where you were in a difficult situation.

title: Cytogenetic Technologist Interview

Interview Questions: What would you do if you got a critical lab value?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Aug 2017

Interview Questions: What made you apply for this job based on the job description?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Process is very slow,  first round - HireVue self video interview, they came up with a feedback after a month. Then a face to face round in Winfield-discussing my resume, cultural fit to the team, job requirements, Some technical questions on Javascript and CSS, again a month for the feedback and next round scheduled with rest of the team in Chicago Campus, they gave me an impression that I almost cleared the interview and the rest of the team wants to meet me. Lead and director took  the interviews individually for 30 min each. They told me in the interview that they liked me and are happy to bring me into the team.
But after a 2 weeks or so, i started sending them emails about the next steps and after another 2 weeks, they just sent me an automated email saying, they are moving forward with other candidates. 
They din't even care to give a feedback as soon as they decided, even after i invested 3.5 months of my time on their interview process.
Interview Questions: Behavior Oriented, technical javascipt

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Group interview  with mangers.  Casual format.  Description of job. Conversational . Low pressure. Easy to schedule the interview. On-line personality test at home prior to interview.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Medical Technologist Interview

title: CRT Interview

title: ATC Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at northwestern?

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: I had applied and within a week, I was invited to an interview. I attended 4 interviews with various departments and still no offer. Everything that they want in a Medical Assistant, I qualified for. Im starting to believe it really is about who you know and not your skills and experience.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my past experiences.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to various open positions for a Registered Nurse. The following day they asked me to do a video interview. I completed the video interview, and twenty minutes later I got an email from HR asking me to come in for an in person interview. I'm going to Chicago tomorrow for the in person interview.
Interview Questions: What do you think you can bring to Northwestern?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, had a video interview with around 15 questions, was emailed a couple hours after submitting the video interview inviting me for an in person interview the following week.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a conflict you've had in the work place

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very pleasant & straightforward. Interviewed by two, basic qualifying questions. I also got a tour of the area I'd be working in. Then told HR would call for new hire proceedings if I was indeed selected.
Interview Questions: How do you deal under stress?

title: Financial Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Persistent contact for interview and wasn't interested. I interviewed in the past. They wanted techno functional which clearly on my resume I did not have technical nvision or sql experience. I had limited experience. Nonetheless the hiring manager told me he was willing to overlook due the extensive background I have during phone interview. Went in for in person interview and was still asked about my techno side. Shortly after I get a call back saying the hiring manager needs techno functional. You wasted my time and 
yours. READ RESUMES!! Pay attention to phone interviews. There is a reason this position is still open. Got a better deal after.
Interview Questions: Do you have nvision experience.

title: Clinical Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Lots of interviews with faculty members. Some were really intense. Some were really laid back. It all depends on your field and specialty. It was a very long day! We had lunch as well.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do with your career.

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Regional Director of Operations Interview

After 30 seconds, the camera would automatically start recording. You had 2 minutes to answer the question.  At the end of 2 minutes, the recording would automatically stop and the next question would pop up.
Interview Questions: What does your background and experience make you qualified for the position?

title: Clinical Practice Clerk Interview

Interview Questions: Tell them about a time about a time I went above and beyond.

title: Clinical Nurse Interview

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received an email to complete a virtual interview. The virtual interview consisted of 6-8 questions and was pretty straight forward. Days later, I was emailed to come in for an in person interview. I received a tour of the facility, shadowed for about 1-2 hours, and later interviewed with the unit managers. I received a call the next day from HR with an offer.
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake and how you fixed it.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was online through HireVue and I am currently waiting to hear back - they said about a month for a response.  Questions were fair and relatively easy/straightforward, as long as you prepared. Hoping to hear back soon.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this internship?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Lake Forest, IL) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview and took exam on pharmacy math. Met with pharmacy manager and other pharmacist they asked typical interview question go over the exam. The test is 10 questions the include converting mg to g and word problems.

title: Cytogenetic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: They want you to record yourself answering interview questions with audio and video. You get one chance to answer each question and only thirty seconds to think of an answer before it starts recording.
Interview Questions: Describe how you handled a conflict with a coworker.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone and in-person interview with a panel of nurses from that unit. The second interview was a ten minute blitz for new grad nurses and was informative, followed my orientation to the floor.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have that apply to this unit?

title: Northwestern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: First did an video interview. Then Got called in for interview then got second interview in the same week. Then a day later got the job. Each interview was with 2 people. We're very nice and professional.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to this position?

title: Medical Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Short, impersonal, standard cookie cutter HR personalities based questions. It's more about your personality than your skills. Skills matter as much as personality does! Should be equally focused. Step-ford wife process
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult co-worker?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I received an e-mail from HR to schedule a 20-minute phone interview and then had a phone screen with the hiring manager. The next day, I received an e-mail from HR to invite me to an on-site interview and requested a few dates within the next couple weeks to meet in-person. I submitted a few dates about 4 days later and didn't receive a response for about 2 weeks. I then received an e-mail stating that the hiring manager decided to interview in-house candidates first. I never received an update.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I started with an Online application. Then Video recorded interview through and external application. They asked you questions and it recorded you. Then got called for an in person interview with a manager.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and why do want a career at Northwestern?

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Timed video recorded interview done online. As well as in person interview with the manager and the finance director. Interview lasted two hours. General questions were asked like what makes you a good candidate.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Got a call from HR to come in for interview. I was asked the basic/standard questions. It was very quick. I showed up, I spoke with a few people- they showed me around and offered me the position.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. A recruiter emailed me/called me for a phone screening. Completed that and was informed about the hireview interview. Completed that process and now have a couple interviews set up with the practice manager. I am hoping to receive an offer
Interview Questions: Why northwestern

Interview Descriptions: Straightforward knowledge on dissection, educational and work experience. Knowledge on autopsies and photography. Efficiency on frozen sections. What do I expect from my job and what salary range do I expect. A lot of situational problem solving questions.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: HR called to set up an interview, received email instructions on how to submit my references. A week later met with unit manager, behavioral questions mainly.  I was asked to shadow a nurse after the interview
Interview Questions: what patient would you see first and why

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Buffalo Grove, IL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went really well. the manager was really knowledgeable and was able to answer any questions i may have had. The interview was conducted over the phone.

Interview was supposed to be in person but time and scheduling constraints limited to a phone interview which led to an offer.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview

Interview Descriptions: The first interview is a video interview. Then you meet for the face to face with the appropriate director. It took me several weeks to get my job offer, as they had a personnel change in the HR department. But other than that the process was pretty easy. The Skype interview was first. They gave you sample questions to prepare but those are not what they ask, unfortunately. The face to face for me was pretty low-key and took place within a week of the video interview.
