Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a virtual interview (you are asked questions on a the screen, you have 30 seconds to prepare your answer and then your answer is video recorded). After that about 2 weeks later I was set up with an in person interview with the hiring manager and the woman I would be replacing. They asked me several pretty generic interview questions and then I was shown around and explained duties the job would entail. After my interview I sent a thank you letter to the hiring manager and then I never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in the workplace?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed over the course of two days. Met with 2  research coordinators for 15 minutes each. Barely any questions were asked they just told me about their jobs.  The next day I was called back  to interview with the two PI's. Interviews were 30 minutes each
Interview Questions: What would your walk out song be?

title: Information Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had to take a test, then they call you back for an interview. The interview took 1 hour. Then they took me on a tour of the facility. I waited several weeks for a call back from HR.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Billing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was offered an in-person interview after my now manager requested I apply for the position. A time was selected and the interview lasted about 20 minutes with some additional time being reserved to meet the available staff.
Interview Questions: What skills do you believe you can offer the organization?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview went so good I thought they would give me a call back sooner but no call not response to voicemail or email, lack of communication very disappointed in northwestern
Interview Questions: How can I contributed to the company

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, contacted two days later to complete a digital interview, recruiter contacted me  the same day to confirm experience and my salary expectations, the next day I was asked to pick a date/time for a two panel interview... the email also stated that if an offer is extended I would receive an email with instruction on how to upload references using the link. Interview lasted one hour and was very relaxed, smooth, and thorough. It was like I was having lunch with two good friends. All the questions I had planned to ask were answered and I was completely in awe. On my way home... I received three emails, including a follow up email from my recruiter asking me "how did it go", I'm only assume that the two managers contacted him as soon as I left.  He just so happened to email me 30mins after my interview and asked me to upload my references using the link provided in the other emails. At this point, it would appear that an unofficial offer is on the table, because I was asked to upload references (which is the next step after the face to face interview). When I receive an official offer...I plan to accept and type up my three week notice for my current employer. The process so far has been fast pace and straightforward. I am absolutely grateful to have been giving the opportunity... and the process itself has been great. I'd give my recruiter and those two managers five stars and two thumbs up.
Interview Questions: They asked mostly about my current role as a CMA, a few problem solving questions, my flexibility, my EPIC training and comfort level, how much notice would I need to provide my current employer.

title: Psychometrist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with two neuropsychologists and a lead psychometrist. They were very relaxed and kind. They made it clear they work like a family and they really care about their patients. Then they gave me a tour and we talked about logistics.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation in which a very upset dementia patient is getting ready to leave in the middle of a test?

title: Pct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Different interview digital interview. I really didn't like the digital interview because I couldn't ask any questions if I misunderstood a question. They only ask you 10 questions. Only thing I don't like about the digital interview is that they determine whether they want to give u a in house interview based off the digital video.  I dislike it because everyone is not a camera person so  if you don't do well on the video version it can cause you to blow your chances of getting a real interview with northwestern medicine.
Interview Questions: What motivate you to work with northwestern?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a three month process. I applied online in November, recorded a video interview in December, then interviewed 1:1 in January, then a group interview, finally another 1:1 in February. I was offered the job that same month and started work mid March.
Interview Questions: Why I want to work for Northwestern

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was emailed with the opportunity to interview with them, I came in, they gave an overview of the department and project, asked me a few questions, then told me they would be in touch.
Interview Questions: Describe how you overcame an obstacle or difficult experience using your skills

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my school's job board for the registered nurse position. I got an email immediately after submitting the application. I completed a digital interview which had about 6 questions I had to answer. It was mainly about past experiences. The next day HR contacted me then spoke with me briefly about the position.
Interview Questions:
Name a time you dealt with a difficult patient and how did you handle it.
If you had a choice, what are 2 units you would work on?

title: Lpn Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago Ridge, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Video interview describing above yourself. Phone interview more about the job, benefits and such. Then you met with HR to discuss time, salary and eligible. Also growth and education offered.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good candidate

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: It initially began as a video interview using an app you had to download. Then each department will contact you depending on the job you applied for. Use caution you may go up to 3-6 interviews with different departments. Be ready for a lot of time dedicated to attending the interviews.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for this company? Why are you interested in leaving current job? Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Director Patient Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially received an email stating I wasn't qualified for position. One week later, received another email "inviting" me to do a one-way video interview. Impersonal. The video interview is  prejudicial. I am over 50 and masters prepare nurse. Two other people I know also interviewed this way. One is black and one is Muslim. None of us were invited for in-person interview; receiving an email stating not qualified.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I got a call from a recruiter who scheduled a HireVue. After the HireVue I was scheduled a face to face interview with the floor manager. Now I'm waiting for a call to schedule third interview with the practice manager.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was very basic. They asked about job history and the status of  my licensure. They asked lost of "example" based questions. Can you give an example of a time when you had a disagreement at work and what you did to resolve it? Can you give an example of a time you solved a problem in the workplace? 
They also asked questions like why do you want to work at Northwestern?

three people interviewed me at once.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit here?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Was very pleasant. Had three interviewees each with different personalities. I truly enjoyed it. My advice is to asked each interviewer questions. About the job, what impact they plan to make with the company,etc.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Analytics Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
5 hours, do to 1.5 hours over. Unplanned interviews with other associates.  The biggest issue is the managers and the directors seem to not have aligned strategies for the candidates they're seeking.
SQL test of 7 questions: mainly aggregate functions and semi-complex joins, 1 hour to complete.
Interview Questions: Why would you want to work for Northwestern?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted almost two months after applying to complete the HireVue interview.  I assumed I had not moved onto the next round, but eventually heard back almost a month later that I was selected for an in-person interview with the hiring manager.  I interviewed with her and another employee I'd be working with for about 45 minutes.  Once I got home I had already received a call from HR to schedule a skills test over basic Microsoft Office programs.  I completed this the following week and was then scheduled for another interview with the Chief of the department who ultimately has the final say.  I met with him for about 30 minutes-super friendly!  I was told I would hear back 'soon' and it has been almost two months.  I reached out to the hiring manager after three weeks for some sort of update and to express interest my in the position, but never received a response.  Super disappointed I went through so many rounds to hear crickets with a company I've always admired and wanted to work with.  The position is still listed as 'accepting applications' for the past 6 months, so I hope they find who/what they are looking for!
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions and asking about experience listed on resume, etc.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was a very short process, you go around and interview with different people from the pharmacy dept. Very short and sweet, they have same day offers. They give out bags of goodies to people they offered the job to, it was great
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Exercise Physiologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with the lead exercise physiologist, head nuclear doctor, and head cardiovascular doctor and had all one on ones with them back to back. Everything was laid out ahead of time and had a schedule of name, job title, and times to meet with them.
Interview Questions: Previous experience?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I received an invitation to complete a digital interview shortly after completing the online application. The interview was straightforward but requires preparation to give your best possible answers. It has been three weeks and I am waiting to be contacted.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this hospital?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview started with a virtual interview then an in person. It was pretty straightforward and related to the specific unit I applied for. The virtual interview was pretty easy, it was just some questions about my background, and the in person interview was more about my specific desire to work on that unit.
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern Medicine?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Professional and discreet process focused on skills and my ability to add value to the organization. Comprehensive review of organization and exposure to a great number of leaders with whom my role would interact.
Interview Questions: Opinions about future of industry and how to influence it

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very casual. There was only one interviewer present and they were extremely nice and open. It felt more like a conversation more so than an interview. They asked very basic questions and gave me a chance to showcase myself. I felt like it was a very positive experience, although I did not get the offer.
Interview Questions:
-Why this unit?
-Tell me your strengths and weaknesses
-How would your friends describe you in 3 words?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online & received an email scheduling a digital interview. Once the interview was done I received another email about 4 days later scheduling an in person interview. I interviewed with three managers & was offered the position the same day. The interview went smoothly, the mangers were very nice. The questions were specifically related to the position itself.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Overall, pretty straight forward and quick. 
I applied on a Tuesday, had a digital interview on Wednesday. Heard back from HR on Monday to schedule an on-site interview and shadowing experience. Got an offer the day following my interview.
Questions were all very normal interview questions, nothing caught me off guard.
HR was very helpful throughout the process with any questions I had.
Interview Questions:
Give me your definition of "teamwork"
Why Northwestern?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview is a digital interview. It is a screening process in a way to determine if you will be given a personal interview. You have 30 secs to prepare an answer for a question and then 3 mins to respond. The interview is easy and can be completed on your own time. HR then called to set up an in person interview.
Interview Questions:
Why northwestern?
Describe a conflict with a coworker and how you dealt with the issue

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first was selected to do a video interview. Never did that before! It was different. You had to download the app on your phone then you were able to do a few test questions. It's basically like an interview in person so you really have to be in a quiet area with professional attire. You are given 30 seconds to answer the questions and the you submit when you're done. Two days later I received an email to schedule a phone interview with the Director of the department. It went really well and she she very friendly. The next day I was offered dates to come in for a in person interview with the Director, the physician I would support, the admin I would replace, and other supporting admin staff. I opted for an early interview so I could go back to work so it was 730am-930am. It went smooth seeing that the surgeon is super busy and was called to the OR. Everyone was friendly. The gave me an overview of the position as well as a mini tour. About 3 hours later I was offered the position with more money than I asked for. Great experience!!!
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a video interview process where I had to answer pre-recorded questions. The 2nd interview was a panel interview with the Practice Manager and the Sr. Practice Manager
Interview Questions: Previous work experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process included a preliminary interview with a panel of four (though only three ended up being present), and a second interview with a panel of four (two returners) and the VP of the Foundation. Answering their questions took up about 40% of the first interview, and 60% of the second. During the first they heavily described what the job would be like, an assistant for the three managers of the Foundation (Estate Planning, Philanthropy). They stressed that it would be a high paced position and that they relied heavily on understanding of excel. They also stressed that it was a temp position, and though their company frequently hired temps on as full time employees, it was temp for an unknown amount of time.
Interview Questions: What was a time you experienced a conflict with a donor? How familiar are you with Microsoft Office? How do you deal with getting what you need through while operating through a bureaucracy? How do you time manage?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back in around a week. First I needed to take an Epic test which took around two hours. The person who administered the test rescheduled four times which was extremely annoying. A week and a half later I was asked in for an interview which was not difficult. Then a week and a half later a was asked to do another interview. Two weeks later I heard back about their final decision. In all this process took three months and I found HR to be very disorganized and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why are you  interested in this position?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simply, HR contacted me three weeks after I applied and right away told me the position was union and the pay rate that they offered, which is the same for all incoming PCTs  regardless of experience level. HR then gave me the option to pick the top three units that I wanted to work for. When I went in for the interview there was a lot of people interviewing and a lot of unit managers present. I got sent to the table of the manager for the unit that was my top choice. After the interview, they separate you into groups in order to perform a skills test which simply includes taking manual blood pressure, pulse, and counting respiration. After the skills test they tell you they will keep in contact.
Interview Questions: 1. Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?

title: Cardiology Tech I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: an online video with a deadline, followed by in-person interview a few days later followed by a phone interview a day or so later. was offered the position during the phone interview along with salary and given the opportunity to accept on the spot.
Interview Questions: can you describe a time you went above and beyond the call of duty to help someone on your job or for a patient?

title: Echo Tech Per-Diem Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Lake Forest, IL) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line through employee referral. Next day I received an e-mail inviting me to take a digital interview, which was the most awkward and stressful experience. Two days later I received a call from a hiring manager, who was very nice and polite over the phone and we discussed in detail everything what the job will be about. The in-person interview was scheduled for Monday of next week. Three days before the interview I got a call from HR asking me questions about my resume. She said: I know you have an in-person interview scheduled but before we move forward, can you tell me why are you CCI registered and not ARDMS? (Same thing except ARDMS is only valid in USA, while CCI is valid throughout the world). On my initial application I stated that I am CCI registered. She arrogantly said that ARDMS is an ABSOLUTE requirement and she has to cancel my interview, to which I said 'It's fine' ( and then thought to myself, what an idiot! She lost such a good asset to the hospital over a little technicality!).
Interview Questions: Does the hospital where you currently work allows you to be CCI registered?

title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The screening interview was computerized which allowed you to record video of you answering questions at whatever time was convenient. They followed up by scheduling an in person interview with the manager and then two hours of shadowing an RN on that unit. Manager interview was five minutes. I did not hear back for over a month despite sending a thank you email and later a follow up email.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: They called me after coming across my resume on Career builder and set up a time for Face time interview. First Assistant came online and ask some general questions then supervisor came and she takes the actual interview
Interview Questions: What are your strengths which you think you can bring if hired?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviews at Northwestern  Medicine are either first with the hiring manager and then a peer interview or the manager sometimes will include peers in the initial interview.  They use behavioral interviewing.
Interview Questions: Everyone has had a time when they had to deal with an unhappy patient or family member. Think of a time when you had to deal with an unhappy patient or patient’s family member.  What was the situation?  How did you handle it? What was the outcome? What could you have done differently that could have potentially changed the initial outcome so that the patient or family member would not been unhappy?

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Warrenville, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sat in with numerous dietitians and was asked various questions regarding past challenges in the work place, team work opportunities, challenges with co-workers, past and current experience, toured the facility.
Interview Questions: How can you describe your role as a team player

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Lake Forest, IL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone screen with recruiter and one hour in-person interview with hiring manager.  Both were completed within one week.  Recruiter moved very fast; phone screen was about 10 minutes long, but she called the very next day to set up the in-person interview.  Hiring manager was not skilled at interviewing but easy to talk with.
Interview Questions: How I handle someone who doesn't like me

title: Fitness Contractor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I had an oral innterview on my group exercise experience.   I was asked questions pertaining to customer service.  I was questioned about modifications I would provide for specialty populations and diagoses.  Also, I had to display my teaching skills through a practical audition.
Interview Questions: How would you modify for participants with Osteoporosis?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and heard back from recruiter a few days after.  Was scheduled to take an online interview which was pretty basic.  Overall, the experience was a little different that what i was use to but I believe that how they conduct their interviews will be the future to how interviews will be.  Again, the online interview server allows you to practice on some questions to allow you to become familiar with how interview process will go.
Interview Questions:
Why would you want to work in health field?

What would you bring to Northwestern?

General questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial digital interview via webcam as a screening process. Then HR called and scheduled an interview with two nursing managers and i did a shadow of the unit for an hour and a half.
Interview Questions: Why nursing?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a computerized skype interview that was slightly awkward but advanced to an in-person interview. It was very painless and almost enjoyable. Very basic interview questions and very kind interview people. I received a call the day after asking if I wanted the job. The only downside was that they wanted an answer in 24 hours, which for someone who is looking at multiple offers, is a bit challenging.
Interview Questions: Name a time you were faced with a challenge and how did you overcome it?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Carol Stream, IL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Found job online and applied. First interview was a pre-packaged video interview which was Skype-like, except there was not a person on the other end to talk to, just a set of questions that you had limited time to answer. Contacted by HR Recruiter to schedule an in-person interview with the hiring manager (1 hour). Follow up with the recruiter after a couple of weeks, the position had been put on hold due to budget issues.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had to tell a customer "no"?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Video and in person interview. A video interview was required first which was sent to all of the Northwestern Medicine locations. It was a series of about five questions. Then the real interview was at the hospital with the nurse manager of the unit.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Northwestern?

title: Immediate Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online; heard form HR approximately 2 weeks later and went in for an in-person interview the same week. Was told I would hear back from the company the following week, never heard anything, and heard the run around from HR. Ended up turning down the position because of the lack of communication.
Interview Questions: What experiences in the past have made you prepared for this position?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by HR via email. Setup a phone screening with HR. Then was forwarded to the hiring manager where I did a phone interview with them. Followed by an in-person interview where I met with small groups of 3-4 people to be interviewed. I also had to do a teach back on a topic of my choice in their Epic System (which is unfair because they were on 2012, and I knew 2014 and higher) I also had to submit training/ tip sheets that I had created.
Interview Questions: How do you keep your students engaged

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Offered a video interview first. Then received a phone call to come in for an in person interview. Offered the job the following day. The interview process was very smooth and the manager was nice and attentive to my questions and answered them in full. She then brought me to interview with three other managers and i was offered the job the following day.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with healthcare networks.

title: Analytics Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Analytics Director showed me around the office and then told me his plan for the position I applied for, and what the kind of work I'll be doing would look like during each phase of the plan. Then, 3 groups of 2 or 3 employees interviewed me, mostly asking about things on my resume.
Interview Questions: What courses have you taken related to statistics or analytics?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two step interview process. First is a video recording and second is an interview with a manager/leader. The video interview, though well set, gets a little bit tricky as you are looking at the clock at the same time as answering questions. The questions though are open ended, so being confident thus help. Practice time is also provided for the interview which makes it easy.
Interview Questions: All the basic interview questions. Very positive two way interaction.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was given an email to do a digital interview (seemed to be a screening process) and then a followup a day later to do an in-person interview with the unit manager. The interview included a day to shadow the unit - so bring scrubs!
Interview Questions: If you had the option of picking, which two units would you want to work on?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I Received an email that I was chosen to do an over the phone Video type interview.  Two weeks after that I was asked to come in for a face to face with the department manager and shift supervisors.  The Interview I thought went very well, so I thought.  A few days  after the interview I sent the recruiter an email to thank them for the interview opportunity and to request feedback on the status of the position.  I never received a response nor did I get an email blast ( which I felt was a small courtesy that a very large and professional organization like Northwestern Medicine could do for candidates to let them know they were no longer being considered) after another week or so went by I reached out to the recruiter to inquire about the status of the position,only to be told that the recruiter was no longer with the company and the candidates that they were working with were being handled by someone else.  I explained that I had interviewed over the phone as well as in person and I really just wanted to see if the position was still available and if I was still being considered.  I provided my name and contact info and was told that they would find out and contact me back.  I waited another week or so and called HR again to check on the status, already realizing that apparently I did not get the position but still kind of hoping that I may have just fallen through the cracks with the initial recruiter whom is now no longer with the company.  The young lady that answered in HR pretty much told me that if I had not heard back from anyone and if the requisition was no longer showing active the position was filled.  Although not the outcome I wanted to hear I guess it was better than hearing nothing at all.   As a courtesy to your candidates, a simple email would have sufficed.
Interview Questions: Define compassion.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online then I did the equivalent of a phone screen, only you video record your answers. Got a call within 3 days to schedule an in-person interview. they  seemed ok at first. Then the red flags came flying. He stated that the clinic had been open three years and they had already had 4-5 managers. RED FLAG! He also stated that there is a lot of animosity between the medical staff and PSRs and management. Yet another RED FLAG! I understand honesty, but they were not making me want to work there at all. He showed me around the clinic all the while talking to staff, and  texting on her phone. Unprofessional. Did not even give me a card to contact to him with any questions. Needless to say I e-mailed the HR recruiter and asked I be taken out of consideration for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Web-based interview with prompted questions, an awkward experience. Recruiter set up in-person interview with floor manager and shadow experience with ICU. I was recommended to step down unit to gain a little more experience as I am a new grad. The interview process continued the following day with two managers. The new grad RN position was offered the following day.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Naperville, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It started with a 20 minute phone screen where I was asked some basic questions to see how well I fit the needs of the position. I was then offered an in person interview that was supposed to be held with two members from Northwestern Medicine. Unfortunately an hour before my interview I received a call telling me that they offered the position to another candidate. It was disappointing but I respect their decision and continue to apply for other openings.
Interview Questions: Q: What made you apply for this position?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted by Computer-assisted personal interviewing (CAPI).  It was the first time I interviewed using this method.  I found the process too impersonal and difficult to complete.  Interviewing in and of itself is a stressful process, but when coupled with the need to focus on camera angles, lighting, and sound quality it becomes very task laden and therefore counter-productive to actually getting to meet and know the candidate up-close and personal.
Interview Questions: Behavioral

title: N/A- Role Was Found Through A Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Strangely, I did not interview in person. My recruiter contacted Northwestern, and I was hired based upon my resume. I was told I was "temp to hire" by my recruiter, but now have to apply separately to the permanent position. Initially, my supervisor was not even aware that I wanted the permanent position, which is very frustrating. However, I blame my recruiter, not him or Northwestern.
Interview Questions: I was not asked any questions.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with HR 10 minutes
Actual interview was long with office 90 minutes but it's all about if you can fit in and that depends on your personality.
Follow up interview was shadowing for 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Why are you trying to leave your current job?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: video interview for a pre-screening. it was a little uncomfortable because you were basically talking to yourself the whole time and there was a countdown as you spoke so it made me a little nervous. I prefer to talk to a real person so that you can at least see the way they are reacting to the answers you give.
Interview Questions: example of time when you were frustrated and how it was handled

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on their website and few days later received email from hr saying they wanna schedule the phone interview.  Two days later the phone interview with hr recruiter took place. I was asked many questions but because I was prepared I had no problem answering it. After phone I got email that on their opinion it went extremely well and they want to schedule me for in person interview with unit manager. She was very nice and asked many questions that she explained sha asks to all candidates. After that I could shadow on the unit. Everyone were very professional and friendly during the process, I noticed a great teamwork on the unit I shadowed. It was a great overall experience and if not for other offer that suits me better I would definitely work there.
Interview Questions: Phone- Why do you want to work for NWM.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Evanston, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Started off with an phone interview, what would you do scenarios, handling irate costumers, from there I receive an offer to come in for a one on one interview. Very straight to the point. Touches on skills and costumer service qualities
Interview Questions: Are you a team player, what can you bring to the table, why northwestern?

title: RN Operating Room Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average, compared to other places I've interviewed. They asked about patient experiences, and information on my work experiences. Nothing too difficult. I was offered the position after I met with HR.
Interview Questions: There were a few questions about how I handled patient expiences

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with two division administrators and two of the doctors who I was going to be assisting. I got lots of information and everyone seemed to think this position would be a good fit given my qualifications. I for the sense that I was wanted and that everyone was pleased to take the time to meet with me.
Interview Questions: You're about to complete a master's program. Do you see a future here, or will you be looking for other opportunities?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral Interviewing, Standard three parts - give me the what it was, what did you do and what was the outcome of the situation.  Pretty standard BI interview questions.
Interview Questions: Standard Behavioral Questions - Three Parts

title: Medical Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Various people within the organization interviewed me.  The role appeared to have various responsibilities and multiple people reporting to the position.  Unfortunately it was a few weeks layer that I heard I did not get the position.
Interview Questions: Where so you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Had two phone interviews, went over qualifications, what company offered.
Next met with practice manager in addition to Department Manager and peers. Basic general  questions were asked. The interview lasted about 30-45 minutes, received tour of department. Pay was discussed after interview with offer letter.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: RN In Patient: Psych Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I had 2 initial phone interviews, first with a talent recruiter then with HR. Next, we scheduled an interview, with unit manager. All of which were separated by 2 week intervals. The in person interview was late due to miscommunication, between unit manager, permanent safety officier and covering safety officier. So, my initial start time of 1330 got pushed to 1350. I did ask  safety about the situation 2x. No assistance. Finally, manager comes out. We clarify the situation, and I meet with other staff. Then I met with manager. Overall the interviews are easy. Was offered a day to shadow but because I decided on another path.
Interview Questions: Situation you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: Interview was average.  Received a phone call interview from HR. Then was scheduled to meet with the hiring personnel of the pharmacy department. Mainly asks about your experiences in pharmacy. After a few days, I received an offer through a phone call from HR and then completion of employment requirements.
Interview Questions: What pharmacy experiences do you have?

title: Clinical Role Transition Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very short. The unit manager and director interviewed me. They gave some information about the unit and their expectations. I was asked basic questions, like why Northwestern? Overall, it was very laid-back.
Interview Questions: Q: Describe your leadership experience.

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Take Epic assessment and interview with hiring manager.  After submitting my background check and references, I had to follow up with HR because I hadn't heard anything for about a month.  The initial hiring manager quit right after my interview and I had to interview again.  The lack of communication was unprofessional and it seemed that hiring valued candidates wasn't a priority.
Interview Questions: What is your interest in working in healthcare? Describe your previous role.

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Good.  She was very communicative in explaining the role.  It gave us an opportunity to exchange words and learn personalities.  She walked me through the department and allowed me to see the environment to see if it was someplace I could work daily.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called after submitting my resume. I did not have a phone interview. I was scheduled for an interview with the program manager. He gave a very basic informal interview. I was given a tour of the building and was offered the job that day.
Interview Questions: What roles have you had in the past where you demonstrated initiative? What actions did you perform at your last position (which was similar to the job I was applying for)

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The process is painfully long and frustrating. You might be contacted by HR 3 months after initial application, then brought in by the department for an interview. My first interview with one Department went extremely well, and I was told by one person high on the decision making chain  "Clearly you are the right person for the job. No one else has your experience. I'll make sure we get you on board ASAP." Then after hearing nothing further for 2 weeks I had to follow up to find the position was filled because someone knew somebody. Then I was called to interview for another department (again, 3 months after applying) and after another month with 2 rounds of interviews, still waiting. Almost not worth it.
Interview Questions: Just basic questions about my experience, nothing too difficult.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I felt immediately welcomed and comfortable during the interview. It was laid back and the questions weren't too tough since I was a new grad. I got to shadow for 3 hours after my interview and see the unit and everyone was amazing.
Interview Questions: Why nursing?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then interview with managers. Interviewers did not appear to be prepared or mind on interview.  Department appeared to be in a disarray.  Process is too long to not received feedback. Require background checks, references from past managers.
Interview Questions: Questions about past experiences and how you handle situations.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Management interview and peer interview.  These were conducted on two separate visits.  There was  one week time span in between as well.  I met with management for approximately 30 minutes and then the peer interview consisted of five employees with random questions.  This lasted approximately twenty minutes.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Anesthesia Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple. They will email you to schedule an interview. Days later there is a phone interview with HR. After this is complete you schedule an interview with management. After you shadow the department supervisor. The next part is a very long wait. The department can tell you they want to give you an offer but they have to wait for HR to schedule orientation and your physical so it takes time. It took about 4 weeks for mine.
Interview Questions:
Why are you here?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
What are your career goals?
What are your education goals?
Whats your background?

title: Managed Care Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Straight-forward interview. Asked several questions regarding my experience in the healthcare industry and my knowledge of the purpose and practice of managed care. Tested my understanding of the mechanics of a healthcare incentives and reviewed my ability to create solutions with Microsoft Excel. Overall, great experience with friendly interviewer and was introduced to a variety of staff following the conversation.
Interview Questions: What is your experience and level of proficiency in developing VBA solutions?

title: Catering Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions, nothing to hard if you do your research on the company and the qualities they're looking for in an employee.The interview process consisted of a recruiter from Hr calling me, and having a phone interview. Then I had face to face interview with the Director .
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern hospital

title: Clinical Quality Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was uneventful interview. The staff were really nice, accommodating and friendly.  The environment was non threatening during the interview process.  I introduced myself and provided the group with my experiences and how can I be an asset to the department based on my clinical experiences.
Interview Questions: Why am I changing my job position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very welcoming and positive walked in and met with the nurse manager and a clinical tech they explaied their expereince and the job and then let me shadow on the unit and another unit to see what it was like.  All of the staff members were awesome
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and within a couple days, got an email from a recruiter scheduling a phone interview.  The phone interview was straightforward, lasting about 15 minutes.  At the end of the call, the recruiter scheduled me for an in-person interview with the managers.  Two weeks later, I had my in-person interview and shadow.  They basically explained how nursing works at NMH, and sent me off to the unit for 3 hours to shadow fellow nurses.  All in all, a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Boston, MA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my resume and application online and received a phone call from HR for follow-up. I had a brief phone interview discussing my experience and interests with the head of HR, which was overall a great experience. They were interested in my answers and very friendly. I was asked specifically what work I would be interested in, and given a list of examples of projects past interns had worked on. I was asked why I was interested in Northwestern Medicine, and how my past experiences had led me to this. Overall a low-stress interview.
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern Medicine?

title: Clinical Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then three separate in-person interviews with doctor, staff, and managers. Everyone was friendly, willing to answer questions, and work to train me until I was comfortable since the previous employee in the position I was interviewing for left without notice.
Interview Questions: What is a difficult situation you have been in at your previous job and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Lake Forest, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Hiring and interview process was very smooth. Interview set up through a temp agency. Great interviewing manager who asked a lot of detailed questions. Manager willing to work with my scheduale and very thankful she could find someone to do the overnight hours. However very confusing with where to go for interview. Went to HR and they had no idea who I was and where I should even be. After about 10 minutes they finally figured out where I should be and ended up being late to the interview because of this.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit for this position?

title: Registered Nurse Cardio/Pulmonary Transplant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the online portal, a friend gave me a contact for the hiring department and was able to set up an interview within the week of application. Meet with two of the three managers, both were very nice and welcoming, very easy to talk with and felt comfortable asking questions
Interview Questions: What is your end goal?, Where do you see yourself in 5 years?, Why do you want to work in Cardio/Pulmonary Transplant?, What made you switch careers? (used to be a teacher)

title: Senior Finance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Talk to detail of your experience and how you will be there asset  to the company
Show your referral from your other company
Tell them a short brief detail of why you want this job
Interview Questions:
Why did you leave your previous job?
Where did you hear about NMH?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The operations interviewer was really nice and helpful. She asked me a few questions that related to my clinical experience and my strengths and weaknesses. She asked me if I had any questions in addition to anything she didn't cover and she was very detailed with her answers. I had the opportunity to meet different managers on the unit including the operations manager and two other managers who were also very nice as well.
Interview Questions: What do you think you can change?

title: Registration Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview gave me a very vague description of what the job really was. I wasn't asked very many questions and I had to wait an extra 30 min because the manager forgot she had a meeting at the scheduled time of my interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy but extremely informative.  I worked with the RN Recruiter, Karen, and she was fabulous.  Kept me informed of the hiring process and so nice to work with.  I'm glad I accepted the offer to work here.  Karen was also nice and worked with other nurses that I referred her to.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you went above and beyond for a patient or co-worker

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: They are very thorough to make sure they only allow in those they can trust with their strict patient confidentiality and care guidelines. I appreciated this. Their concern for their patients' privacy and care is very refreshing. A hospital should be this way.
Interview Questions: i didn't encounter anything difficult- if you're honest it's a smooth process.

title: OR Assist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: i was given an email link to download a video\audio app to HIREVUE.  I used my laptop and answered 8 questions on video.  I dressed as if I were leaving my home.  I felt this was a cold and impersonal.
Interview Questions:
Why am I a good fit for Cadence Health?
My experience for the position

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Received call from HR rep, did over the phone question review, scheduled first interview with manager, went through basic position questions and was informed about the company. Went to the final interview with VP waiting for final call.
Interview Questions: How have I handled conflict

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Winfield, IL) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  I then received an email inviting me to the job fair.  I met with three or four people and got hired, pretty much, immediately.  I thought the process was very well run.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.  Tell me what you would do in this situation.

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, Video interview answering set series of questions, Called to set up panel interview, Create a presentation as part of panel interview, Asked to supply a list of references within 24 hours that receive a 20-30 questionnaire, Then wait for some kind of response
Interview Questions:
Questions weren't difficult. However the detailed list of questions to your references is an extensive  boiler-plate list of items that not every reference could possibly answer. This could end up working against you, if someone else has a reference that is more familiar with all of these items. 
Also with only 24 hours to provide, it was difficult to actually line up all references and let them know to be on the look out because they may receive a long questionnaire. I wasn't able to contact all prior to the process time running out.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very easy..It seems that take a liking to people who already have healthcare experience. In the Administration, that's plus and it goes a long way with Physicians, clinical directors, etc
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was initially given a phone interview with someone in HR.  They asked me what seemed like a series of preset questions about experiences I have had and how I handled them,  Afterwards I was asked to come in for an interview with two managers.  I was made to wait for 20 minutes on the floor with no idea if I was in the right place.  The interview was easy, just asked why I wanted to be a nurse and given several scenarios in which I had to prioritize or explain how to respond.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Apply via online platform; take an online personality/psych assessment test (tip: they are looking for the traits of teamwork, altruism, and an engaged workforce).  If make it past the initial psych and resume screen, resume forwarded to hiring manager who instructs HR to contact those they want to interview.  In-person interview with HR and hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Job-specific clinical questions; typical behavioral interview questions (i.e. describe a situation in which you had a challenge, worked with a difficult person, turned a loss into win, etc.)

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the career site. It took about 2 months for someone from HR to contact me for a Phone interview. I passed that and went in for an in person interview about a week later. Pretty easy and laid back interview. I then was asked to take a test to make sure my excel skills were up to par. I did not hear anything for about a month and a half. Assumed I did not get the position. After waiting this length of time I was contacted by phone by HR saying they were pursuing other candidates
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Data Analyics Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone screening with HR followed by onsite interview with a Director and Manager. Laid back, low pressure interview. Straightforward SQL test at the end of the interview. Called back for second round interview with team members the next week. Interviewed with three separate team members, also laid back and low pressure. Received an offer a few days later.
Interview Questions: Initial phone screening included many rapid fire questions about job experiences ("talk about a time you handled a difference of opinion with a coworker," etc. If you understand the position and why you want it, everything after was fairly easy.

title: Unit Se Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy going and the managers are great. Always ask to shadow to make an everlasting impression on the hiring manager. Went in Monday for interview knew the same day I had got the job
Interview Questions: What are you weaknesses?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: After applying online, applicants must complete an hour-long survey online. Next was a phone interview, then an onsite interview. 1-2 weeks between each, so expect to have time in between where there is no communication whatsoever.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you dealt with a difficult customer. How did you handle the situation?

title: Supply Chain Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received an email 8 weeks later stating they were seeking other candidates.  4 weeks after that I received a phone call from HR to see if I was still interested. 

I came in for 2 separate interviews, one with HR and the other with 2 supply chain managers. After my interviews I was told I'd receive a case study to complete. 

The case study was never sent and I received a phone call from HR 3 weeks later informing me for a second time that they are pursuing other candidates.
Interview Questions: Why Northwestern?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview involved a shadow day followed by a group peer interview by the current unit staff as well as meetings with the department managers and directors.  I was interviewing for two different positions within the same department so part of the shadow experience was to determine if one of the positions would be a better fit than another.
Interview Questions: Clinical questions were presented in a very broad manner.

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Must fill out application on website. Straightforward interview/hiring process.
Interview Questions: there weren't any unexpected questions. It was all very straightforward.

title: Social Work Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty much straight forward. I received a call or phone screening to begin. We set up the in person interview which was team based. They asked straight forward questions and it was a breeze. I then followed up with a one on one interview with the director
Interview Questions: Why am I intrested in the postion

title: Physician- Hospitalist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: You need to be top 5 percent of your graduating class to get an interview. For every 100 applicants, about 5 get interviews. Highly sought out location and organization. I would not apply unless you have been exceptionally successful. Especially the hospitalist group which is a highly skilled group of doctors.
Interview Questions: They will grill you on what you can contribute to the organizaiton.

title: Property Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the website and got an immediate phone call from the HR Manager.  We spoke for about 30 minutes on my current position and why I was looking to change my position.  Everything was very straightforward.  She really enjoyed our conversation and immediately asked me to come in.
Interview Questions: They asked academic type of questions, none that stood out to be difficult.  Not the usual questions during an interview.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Three peers interview prospective employees. Then if accepted the laboratory supervisor will interview you one to one. They are looking for a positive personality , flexibility and work ethic, as well as ability.
Interview Questions: What software do you have experience with. Are you able to be flexible and work all shifts if needed.

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, completed phone screen.  Then called in for interview with Director, and a 2nd interview with a physician at the practice.  I assume I did not get the job; but no one ever followed up and formally rejected me.  The same thing happened with someone else I know that interviewed for a different position.  They do not let you know if you were not selected, even when you have interviewed in person.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Scheduling and assisting patients, insurance verification, and proving excellent customer service. We are also the front face of Northwestern, and assist patient's daily with a variety of needs, and requests. We send messages to doctors, page physicians, and other clinical staff. We also take messages to send directly to a variety of staff members.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths, and what are you weaknesses?
Name one time you weren't able to meet a patient's expectations, and how did you handle the situation?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone interview which I thought went quite well. The interviewer was very polite and prompted some really precise answers to her questions.
Interview Questions: Have I ever been in a position where I had to make an important decision for the company.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on-line and was contacted by HR.  I was living cross country so they initially did a phone interview with Human Resources.  I then flew in and interviewed with the manager, received a tour of the Unit and was offered the position.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from Human Resources to schedule a phone interview, after the phone interview I was asked to come in for a formal interview. After the in-person interview i was told that someone would contact me within a week and I never received a call and when I called and left a message no one returned my call.
Interview Questions: They asked if I had any experience with their hospital software and said they were looking for someone who had experience with their software. My resume clearly stated what software I had experience in, what a waste of my time and theirs.

title: Coder Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by HR just a couple of weeks later. I had an initial phone interview with HR and then an in-person interview with the coding manager. The interview was great; no unexpected questions and the manager made me feel very welcome. A week after the interview I was contacted by HR and offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Northwestern Medicine (Chicago, IL) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I would suggest to candidates to keep applying to get your name seen. I applied 5 times before they called me in. It is best to find out who the recruiter is and then send them a cover letter and resume. DONT FORGET to send a thank you letter after the interview. After all it helped me land the job. Firt the candidate interviews with the HR recruiter. If you do well they take you to the manager of where you want to work. If not, they tell you we will contact you (but they will not) and they tell the manager you weren't a fit.
Interview Questions: What three words best descibe you?
